Dead by Daylight holds great potential for even further growth and development with its fundamentally unique gameplay design as a one-versus-four asymmetric multiplayer online horror game; that potential, however, is ultimately hindered by the sheer obstinacy and ignorance of the game's developers themselves, who constantly overlook the presence of imbalanced core game mechanics within Dead by Daylight that often create unfair and frustrating situations in matches for players to deal with, and are also utterly lacking in their efforts and dedication to designing innovative additional elements for the game that can consistently engage the interest of players. Furthermore, the developers appear to be growing disconnected from the game's very own player community, given their evident and continual disregard for feedback provided by the players about its potential issues as well as the questionable changes made to its features; for instance, when they decided to proceed with implementing their initial designs for the latest revamps of the game's heads-up display and matchmaking system, despite a vast majority of the players openly voicing their dissents and dissatisfaction with those changes beforehand when previews of them were released.

The game's only saving graces are its well-composed and mostly distinctive killer chase themes which really help in heightening the gameplay experience for players in my opinion, and also its graphics (especially for new and reworked game map locations) which has seen considerable improvements in quality throughout the years. Hats off to the sound and graphical design teams of Dead by Daylight for doing such a splendid job at fulfilling their respective roles so far.
